message: Honestly are these correct? Some of the things I see trending just have me wondering how accurate it is.
Today for example "Lil Zane" (no idea who he is) is trending but something like the NFL draft isn't. I know not everyone watches the NFL Draft but it's a pretty big deal for a lot of tweeps.

Well it also depends on how many people are online at the time. Americans are into football a lot, but with other countries not so much. Twitter is global anyways. And topics that aren't trending can still get a lot of activity. Just search for NFL draft and I'm sure you'll see hundreds of messages within minutes.

I was just using the NFL as an example. I understand it may not be trending I just happen to see a lot of unusual topics trending and was curious how accurate trending topics was. I use search.twitter.com all the time. It's a great service.
I think it is fairly accurate because music/celebrities are more universal than a local sport and the fact that like Facebook, Twitter gets 70% of it's traffic from countries outside the us.
That makes sense although I thought I had my trending topics to just read US... maybe not.
So after the NFL draft is over #NFLDraft is trending and promoting. Just odd to me.
